alert.note: Alert for Coos (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 29 at 6:18AM PST until January 29 at 11:15PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Oregon... Coquille River at Coquille affecting Coos County. For the Coquille River...including Coquille...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Coquille River at Coquille. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 21.0 feet, The Coquille River is at flood stage. Expect flooding of farmland and low-lying areas throughout the flood plain along the Coquille River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:45 AM PST Monday the stage was 21.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 20.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will hover just above flood stage with a maximum value of 21.1 feet this morning. It will fall below flood stage this afternoon. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 21.1 feet on 01/01/1997. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 630 PM PST.
